titleInfo.title: Demolition of the Andrew Jackson Hotel, 1971

name.namePart: Nashville Housingity/Metropolitan Development and Housing Agency

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Photograph of the demolition of the Andrew Jackson Hotel, located at the corner of 6th Avenue North and Deaderick Street, 13 June 1971. The hotel was demolished in order to make way for the James K. Polk Office Building, which currently contains the Tennessee Performing Arts Center. The Andrew Jackson Hotel opened its doors in August of 1925, a 12-story structure that boasted 400 guest rooms, and was designed by Marr & Holman architects. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
